data.title: cut lobby changes from a resulting replay file
data.body: there is no need to store all lobby changes in saved replay, which can take the half size of it ( > 1MB )

data.title: fix/balance RA map Athena (koth)
data.body:
1. Reduced strategic victory timer from 10 to 3 minutes to increase pressure on players.
2. Increased the size of the starting islands in order to give a player more strategic options.

Removed _Options: OpenRA.MapOptions_ as seen in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3939. Checked all starting positions in-Game.

data.title: Prevent pixel doubling of group / pip / tag / chevron decorations.
data.body: Followup to #3933.

data.title: Remember filter checkbox states in server browser
data.body: I always filter out empty and also view incompatible. Every time I join a game, or change mod, I have to check the correct boxes again

data.title: Add missing [Translate]s to support power widgets
Show map description in map browser
data.body:
It might be helpful to add the content of the map _Description:_ to the map browser after a map has been selected. That way, every player can read if there is anything special in the map, or if the map has a specific playing style / game mode.

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: fix/balance on RA map Apollo
data.body: Southern side of map lacked 1 oil derrick and 1 oil patch / added to southern side of map.

data.title: Added a Game ID and print it to syncreport.log
data.body:
together with the player name for easier comparison.

As discussed in #2570.

Ripped from #2854.

data.title: Gives ant adequate health radius and fixes instant turn
data.body: Ant was using the same tiny health radius as other infantry. Additionally, I gave it a ROT value so it no longer insta-turns up to 180° without the slightest delay.

data.title: Fixed spawnpoints in chrome.yaml (D2K, TS, RA)
data.body:
Fixed spawnpoints in chrome.yaml (D2K, TS, RA)
Fixes #3931

data.title: Can't place turrets in Fort Lonestar
data.body: because of the BaseProvider introduced in #3894

data.title: Don't zoom UI lines when pixel doubling.
data.body: These changes keep the line width of the selection boxes / selection bars / range circles / target constant when zooming, which makes pixel doubling much more useable.

data.title: Improve debug overlays
data.body: This adds health radius rendering, fixes the A\* overlay, and includes some general tidying of these traits.

data.title: Spawn points aren't rendered in the map chooser in RA/TS/D2K.
data.body: Regression introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3921.

data.body:
scrollthumb-hover & scrollthumb-pressed updated in chrome.yaml (TS, D2K,
RA)

data.title: Start Replay on double click
data.body: followup of #3738

data.title: Home key doesn't work on the textfield of the IRC chatroom
data.body:
In the textfield of the IRC chatroom, if you type a long sentense (longer than the textfield width), you can notice that the Home key doesn't make the blinking cursor go back to the beginning of the sentense.

Nonetheless, if the sentense is short it works.

data.title: EjectOnDeath - updated and 100% working
data.body:
I am very thankful to the great people of this community for spending hours to teach me many new things and I know I have much more to discover, so expect many more annoying nights. ;)

EjectOnDeath original PR: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3922

Updated EjectOnDeath:
• Works the exact same way for people using only .yaml to make mods

``` yaml
UNIT:   
    EjectOnDeath:
        PilotActor: e1
        SuccessRate: 20
```

• Internally there are 2 versions.

```
º Version 1: All code contained in OpenRA.Mods.RA/EjectOnDeath.cs
    (except yaml values: mods/ra/rules/defaults.yaml - example above)

º Version 2: Crafted by pchote, changes 4 files (along with EjectOnDeath.cs):
    ˚ OpenRA.Game/Traits/TraitsInterfaces.cs
    ˚ OpenRA.Mods.RA/Air/Aircraft.cs
    ˚ OpenRA.Mods.RA/Crate.cs
    ˚ OpenRA.Mods.RA/Husk.cs
```

• EjectOnDeath.cs was moved from Mods.RA/Air to the root of Mods.RA because it no longer only applies to aircraft.

data.title: Manpage
data.body: `man openra` to list command line options like `Game.Mods=ra` or `Settings.Renderer=Cg`.

   bei OpenRA.Program.FatalError(Exception e)
   bei OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

pls help me =(

data.title: Filter repeated actions
data.body:
> In AoE, clicking repeatedly when the users were excitedly attacking (clik-lik-lik-lik-lik -- go go go ) was causing huge spikes in the number of commands issued per second -- and if they were pathing a large group of units -- huge spikes in the network demand as well. A simple filter to discard repeat commands at the same location drastically reduced the impact of this behavior.

http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/131503/1500_archers_on_a_288_network_.php?page=2 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1013546-filter-repeated-actions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: New EjectOnDeath system.
data.body:
This new EjectOnDeath system allows for vehicles (aircraft or ground units) to eject a PilotActor with a percent SuccessRate upon death.

This also eliminates the MinimumHeight check that is currently being used, and replaces it with two booleans;
PilotEjectOnGround: yes/no
PilotEjectInAir: yes/no
It is possible to have both set to yes/true with the result being as expected.

In defaults.yaml:
^Vehicle and ^Tank have a 20% chance to eject an e1 while OnGround.
^Plane has a 50% chance to eject an e1 while InAir.

This is my first contribution so I am very excited for it and hope it comes in handy for someone (along with being accepted and merged)!

data.title: Updated chrome.yaml and dialog.png (RA,D2K,TS)
data.body:
I have updated chrome.yaml and dialog.png files for RA, D2K, TS mods.
Featuring "button-hover" and "textfield-hover" states.

data.title: Minor cleanup of the main folder
data.body: Renamed and relocated fonts, removed unused icon.

data.title: Some sounds are quiet
data.body:
- Win7
- All 3 volumes are turned to max
- Audio device: default output
- Tested on bleed, both RA & TD repro

Some sounds seem to be very quiet, defying my audio settings. Building construction/selling are always quiet; EVA notifications are normal (these actually do go up/down in volume depending on my sound volume setting ingame), tank/bullet explosions are always quiet, so on.

data.title: Negative Prerequisites
data.body:
I've wanted to get involved with this beautiful project for quite some time but have nothing to contribute other than ideas.

This may already be implemented in some way but I feel that negative prerequisites could make multiple tech-tree branches easier to create/manage/cross.

With an addition like this a system could be put in place to allow more unique play styles to be born. Maybe even a research-esque approach to Missions/Gametypes or whatnot.

In Tiberian Sun there is an upgrade building (I cannot remember the name) and with the different plugins you could get different pros/cons.

I'm sorry I cannot seem to come up with better words for this, I hope someone understands. I would play with the source and try and implement this myself but I am quite inexperienced and do not understand even 50% of it.
